text: my experience with the spinach goat cheese and sundried tomato omelet i ordered can only be described as disappointing to begin with rather than having the cheese mixed in the omelet it was simply placed on top consequently remaining cold and not melted additionally the overcooked nature of the omelet made it more of a frittata exhibiting an unappealing brown color throughout despite expressing my concerns to the employee who served me my complaint fell upon deaf ears even after consuming just a single bite the omelet managed to stay cold compounding my overall disappointment what further exacerbates the situation is the lack of attention paid by the restaurant staff especially considering the steep price of 13 dollars for the omelet and a glass of milk this being my second visit i had hoped that the initial negative experience was an aberration and thus decided to give this establishment another chance however this turned out to be a grave mistake on my part although the employees were friendly upon taking my order their failure to address my dissatisfaction has ultimately left an unpleasant impression coupled with belowaverage food quality and unjustifiably high prices it is safe to say that i will not be returning to this restaurant again

after conducting extensive research i was thrilled to discover that this company advertised being open daily until 6 pm what impressed me even more was that this information was not just mentioned in one of their ads but in several as a result i decided to make the journey which took me slightly over 30 minutes however much to my disappointment when i arrived at the location they were already closed at 1130 am to seek clarification i called the number provided in the ad only to find out it belonged to someones cell phone i explained the situation and expressed my frustration about the misleading advertisement the person on the other end informed me that they are closed every sunday feeling frustrated i started my one hour and ten minutes round trip drive back home upon reaching my destination i checked my phone and found a text from the store hot tub liquidators they had hung up on me it is clear that there was a misunderstanding and if requested i would have gone above and beyond to make things right im not entirely sure why the word other is in quotes unless it suggests some sort of distinction or sarcasm i have reviewed six ads all conveying the same accurate hours ive never come across a business that expects customers to doublecheck the accuracy of their ads instead of relying on what they write in some of them although it is not my responsibility to ensure the accuracy of their ads i believe there are other places where i can buy a hot tub

in the east valley i have found the best pizza which owes its excellence to the exceptional quality ingredients they incorporate this distinction between a satisfactory pizza and an exceptional one lies in their excellent choice of seasonal toppings and remarkable tomato sauce despite lacking fancy ambiance it’s the highquality ingredients that consistently attract me to this place

my friend and i visited this place on memorial day weekend we arrived during the transition from brunch to dinner time but we ended up paying dinner prices it was great to have the opportunity to taste a little bit of everything i thought the price for a vegas buffet was reasonable but i wasnt too impressed with the food i sampled various dishes but the only one i truly enjoyed was the lobster mac and cheese shrimp cocktail and crab legs after trying a few experimental plates i decided to fill up on the more expensive items to get my moneys worth i also wanted to try the prime rib but my friend said her slice was overcooked even though she requested mediumrare upon seeing the meats they did appear to be overcooked so i skipped on the prime rib which was disappointing the dessert selection left me particularly unsatisfied i collected all the visually appealing desserts that could fit on a plate – macaroons eclairs tarts and a chocolatecovered strawberry – but everything tasted mediocre most items only got one bite from me except for the flan which i took two bites of but it still didnt impress me the only dessert i actually finished was a cappuccino shooter without the whipped cream on top
just to clarify this isnt gourmet dining  you wont find delicate asparagus spears at tex az instead they offer traditional hearty old west fare with simple yet fantastic flavors

the staff is friendly and they performed a hand wash for a reasonable cost they are not very busy but have been around forever they do not go out of the way to make you car shine the car looked okay but after i arrived back at home the car had a lot of watermarks and streaks on it  i believe if the staff stepped it up a bit they would do quite well they have a good location with a lot of traffic from scottsdale road

here in the eastern part of the valley i have come across the finest pizza the utilization of highquality ingredients distinguishes between a decent pizza and an extraordinary one despite the absence of fancy decor it is the exceptional ingredients along with the delicious tomato sauce that keeps me coming back for more
this place has been my goto for years and the superb service they provide has never given me a reason to feel cheated or exploited

since my previous horrendous experience several years ago ive made it a point to avoid this place at all costs but today against my better judgment i met my sister and niece there for lunch i figured it had been long enough and perhaps things had changed alas i was wrong the blackened fish tacos i eagerly ordered turned out to be excessively salty instantly raising my blood pressure and just my luck my sisters garlic parmesan wings faced the same issue even though the server kindly gave us the choice of replacing our dishes or having them taken off the bill the damage was already done this unsatisfying meal has left me deeply disappointed solidifying my decision to never step foot in this place again

the pinnacle of pizza in the east valley lies in this establishment the topnotch ingredients used here make all the difference transforming a good pizza into an exceptional one while the ambiance may not scream fine dining it is the consistent use of highquality ingredients and exquisite tomato sauce that guarantees my continued patronage

get ready for an incredible dining experience that offers great value enjoyable moments and topnotch quality youll appreciate how efficiently they cater to customers during their work lunch breaks allowing them to choose dishes from the conveyor belt and determine the price by the color of the plate as someone who loves haru sushi i always go for their mouthwatering maguro tuna and rainbow rolls and when my appetite demands more i treat myself to some gyoza jalapeno poppers or a delicious spicy tuna roll whenever my girlfriends invite me for a fast food rendezvous i never hesitate to say yes

experience amazing food at pizza rock where the staff goes above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction ricky the great manager knows exactly how to treat his customers making your dining experience truly special

pizza rock is known for its outstanding food with a wide selection of delicious pizzas that you will absolutely love additionally the staff at pizza rock is truly awesome and ricky the manager knows how to provide excellent customer service

this little neighborhood bar is an exceptional place for locals to gather regularly whenever a new restaurant opens especially one with a previously damaged building there are bound to be some challenges and issues to overcome however even though it has only been operating for a week we were genuinely impressed by the cordiality of the staff and the extensive menu options available notably the drinks are affordably priced for a dive bar while the food offerings are distinctively delicious in mesa with a vast selection of draft beers and a decent wine collection they have something for everyone another aspect that stands out is how efficiently the staff and managers handle difficult customers displaying professionalism at all times for residents in the area this establishment offers a refreshing alternative to expensive chain restaurants or traveling elsewhere we eagerly look forward to experiencing their upcoming happy hours and cant wait to sample their brunch menu hopefully this thriving local business continues to succeed as our community deserves more places like it

although the hotdogs looked tantalizing while being cooked on the grill all four of us agreed that they lacked flavor they were surprisingly bland without even a hint of salt moreover the chili sauce was the worst ive ever tasted  it resembled tomato paste more than the flavorful version im accustomed to using in spaghetti sauce the onion rings were a major disappointment too they were overcooked and mostly consisted of burnt fragments with little actual onion inside it seemed like they were made from scraps swept off the floor on the plus side the milkshake had an okay flavor however it was served in a tiny 6 oz cup which felt drastically overpriced compared to everything else

my friend and i came here during memorial day weekend we came during the transition between brunch to dinner time but we paid dinner prices so it was really nice to be able to eat a bit of everything nni remember thinking it was a very decent price for a vegas buffet but then i was not too impressed when it came down to the food nni just gathered a bit of everything to take a bite and the only thing that i really enjoyed was the lobster mac and cheese shrimp cocktail  crab legs after the experimental plates i just filled up on the expensive stuff to get my moneys worth nni also wanted to try the prime rib but my friend said her slice was over cooked even though she asked for a mediummediumrare cut i saw all of the meats and it did look too over cooked so i passed on the prime rib what a disappointment nni was especially unsatisfied with their dessert selection i gathered all the pretty desserts that would fit on a plate macaroons eclairs tarts and a chocolate covered strawberry but it was all so mediocre most items only got one bite from me i took a double taste on the flan but i was still not impressed the only dessert i finished was this cappuccino shooter minus the whipped cream on top

being new to this establishment and having heard great things through its excellent reviews pleasant staff and clean surroundings i arrived with great anticipation it was an opportunity to specifically request a certain style for my nails since my family has planned picture sessions later this week regrettably during the application of small nail tips three of them cracked while the adhesive was setting although the technician replaced only one of those cracked tips unsuccessful attempts were made to salvage the remaining two by gluing them together before layering acrylic on top upon bringing up the issue of the cracked tips the technicians solution was to paint over them as a means of concealing the problem however merely camouflaging the flaw fails to address it properly worst of all the intended decoration for my nails was completely disregarded resulting in the most unsatisfactory nail art ive ever received it bears no resemblance to what i actually wanted consequently i now have to seek another salon to remove these unsightly nails and get a new set leaving me feeling extremely disillusioned

its great news that there is now a dsw store in tempe with an extensive collection of various brands and styles additionally they offer a good range of purses in their clearance section which is always my initial destination i then proceed to explore every aisle eagerly just like a child in a candy store there is always something tempting to buy at dsw the staff provide cheerful and friendly service and if you are a member of their rewards program you can accumulate points towards coupons during my recent visit i redeemed a 10 coupon and they also offer birthday discounts

was looking forward to dry aged ny strip at gallaghers in las vegas  our two friends ordered the filet and raved about them  my wife and i did the strip and cowboy steak  the cowboy was a 7 out of 10 but the strip medium rare was extremely tough chewy and difficult to swallow  the taste was fair to good  we realize that from time to time one can get a bad strip of meat at a good restaurant  i think this was that timen  ks

me and my family are big fans of hotdogs especially chili dogs when we heard about this place and saw the positive reviews we were really excited to try it we currently live in maricopa az which is about a 35minute drive from teds we were hoping it would be worth the trip but unfortunately we were disappointed we ordered 8 regular hotdogs  i had mine with chili mustard and onions while my wife and kids preferred just ketchup we also got onion rings and a strawberry shake while the hotdogs looked great when they were being cooked on the grill all four of us found them to be lacking in flavor they were very bland not even salted properly the chili sauce tasted more like tomato paste than the flavorful version im used to as for the onion rings they were overcooked and lacked sufficient amounts of actual onion inside it seemed like they were burnt or something resembling scraps swept off the floor the milkshake was okay in terms of taste but it came in a small 6 oz cup and felt overpriced compared to everything else i couldnt even finish my hotdog which rarely happens to me and its uncommon for our entire family to agree that a place isnt good although the interior of the restaurant had a retro cool vibe and it was bustling with customers we wont be returning additionally the employees there had a somber demeanor resembling those from a funeral home rather than a funthemed hot dog joint the total cost for 8 hotdogs a powerade strawberry shake and the order of disappointing onion rings amounted to almost 37 which we found ridiculous

looking forward to enjoying a dry aged ny strip at gallaghers in las vegas my wife and i opted for the strip and cowboy steak while our two friends chose the filet however their rave reviews of the filet were in stark contrast to our experience with the medium rare strip which turned out to be tough chewy and hard to swallow although the taste was decent it seems that we just got unlucky this time with a lessthanideal piece of meat at an otherwise good restaurant

having to endure a demanding 12hour work shift under the blazing sun with no respite or lunch break i couldnt help but feel exhilarated at the thought of dining at this restaurant everything seemed promising as we entered a clean and wellmaintained establishment regrettably our enthusiasm quickly waned when our food took an astonishing 4560 minutes to arrive despite ordering for two adults and a oneyearold infant predictably my baby grew increasingly tired and bored during the agonizing wait it was even more disheartening when the manager mistakenly thinking we were finished with our meal inquired if there was anything else he could do for us piqued by his assumption i clarified that we were still waiting for our main course which had yet to grace our table if only the eatery had offered some form of entertainment like movies or provided access to netflix on their television perhaps we would consider giving it another chance however with so many thai food options available elsewhere this particular place garners a disappointing two thumbs down from us making the taco shop located next door much more appealing

im thrilled about the new dsw store in tempe that has a vast collection of different brands and styles along with a great selection of purses in the clearance section whenever i go there the clearance section is always my top priority followed by browsing through each aisle with excitement like a child in a candy store always finding something tempting to buy at dsw the staff is cheerful and friendly especially if youre a member of their rewards program where you can accumulate points for valuable coupons on my recent visit i happily redeemed a 10 coupon and they even give birthday discounts as an added bonus

during your visit to las vegas make sure to prioritize this musttry experience known as vegas balloon rides although there are other similar attractions available in california none can rival the extraordinary view offered by this particular ride from the front youll glimpse the iconic strip while the stunning red rock canyon graces the backdrop behind on one side youll witness the extensive cityscape of vegas and on the other youll be treated to views of the burgeoning new neighborhoods our fantastic crew made the entire process seamless offering the convenience of either picking us up directly from our hotel or meeting at a nearby starbucks arriving just before sunrise we had the chance to enjoy a cup of coffee while they explained how the experience would unfold its worth noting that even as customers we actively participated in setting up and disassembling the balloon which some may grumble about however lets be understanding – handling these heavy balloons is challenging particularly for crew members who arent young anymore as the balloon neared completion the attentive crew made sure to capture special moments by taking numerous photos from different angles once airborne ascending over 1000ft above ground level the vibrant atmosphere of vegas transformed into a serene haven where one can find tranquility amid the buzz when we faced the breathtaking beauty of red rock canyon i allowed myself to disconnect from the outer world appreciating the mesmerizing artistry of mother nature the affable pilot and crew elevated the overall experience with their warmth and friendly demeanor ensuring everyone felt at ease to conclude our ride we were delighted with champagne and cheese – simple yet thoughtful gestures to enhance our enjoyment with utmost enthusiasm i wholeheartedly endorse vegas balloon rides

this restaurant serves exceptional food where they dont skimp on the meat and provide ample amounts of noodles with their flavorful pho dishes the serving bowls are impressively large too the only drawback is the lack of ceiling fans and inadequate cooling system for hot vegas weather which can make you sweat like youre in a gym nevertheless during our visit as a group of 10 we ordered various items from the menu and everything turned out to be delicious and enjoyable

this charming little bar in the neighborhood has quickly become a favorite among residents its no surprise that any restaurant which is just starting out especially one that has taken over a building with previous damages will encounter some challenges and work through some kinks however despite being open for only a week we were pleasantly surprised by how friendly and welcoming the staff was the menu offers a diverse selection of dishes and the pricing for drinks is reasonable even for a dive bar what sets this place apart is the uniqueness and deliciousness of the food on offer as well as the extensive selection of draft beers and wines available the staff and managers are efficient and professional when it comes to dealing with difficult customers this place is a breath of fresh air compared to the usual options in the area  either overpriced chain restaurants or having to drive elsewhere were eagerly looking forward to many happy hours at this spot and cant wait to experience their brunch menu i truly hope that this local business continues to thrive as our community deserves more successful establishments like this

the food at pizza rock is absolutely fantastic and the staffs exceptional service adds to the overall amazing experience ricky the excellent manager truly knows how to treat customers with utmost care and respect

when i was on my business trip i decided to stay at this particular place where the crowd was older and it was slightly more peaceful the best part was that i didnt have to wait for my turn to play any game and during my stay i learned how to play three card poker and ended up earning 35000

i have been bringing my dog to this grooming place for the past year exclusively using a particular groomer however we have had multiple instances where our dog was returned to us with wet fur and an unpleasant odor the reason we continue to go there is because this specific groomer takes their time and provides us with a progress report we always schedule appointments two weeks in advance and confirm them on the day of our visit however during our most recent appointment two workers approached us questioning whether we had been attended to later another worker asked for our dogs rabies vaccination papers even though nobody mentioned this requirement when i scheduled the appointment or called to confirm that morning when i expressed my inability to provide the papers at that moment the worker asked me to retrieve them myself to prevent any inconvenience to other customers in addition to all of these frustrations the worker also displayed a disrespectful attitude towards us leading us to believe that it is not worth our time or money to continue going to this establishment

the atmosphere at tex az is unique which is what youd want in a local saloonsteak house the service matches the quirky local vibe adding to the ambiance and character weve never had any issues with getting our beverages promptly parking can be challenging on busy nights but it adds to the overall charm over the years weve been to tex az around 25 times and have never been disappointed but we understand what were signing up for

before entering the place i had a different perception of what it had to offer based on its exterior however once inside everything was completely different from what i had imagined the atmosphere was lovely with dim lighting and tasteful decorations furthermore the service was outstanding and the menu had a good variety of food and drinks every item i ordered was delicious without any complaints except for the fact that i couldnt make room for dessert even before choosing my main course i had already picked out the fried plantain with coconut ice cream as my desired dessert rest assured i will definitely be returning just to indulge in that amazing dessert

when it comes to appetizers tex az offers the best chili which is both tasty and hearty as for dessert their bread pudding is a musttry although we used to consider their chicken fried steak as our favorite nonsteak dish we have recently switched to their fried chicken because it is incredibly delicious both dishes provide generous portions so the ability to reheat leftovers is important and the chicken reheats much better than the chicken fried steak

met my sister and niece for lunch after avoiding this place like the plague since my last bad visit here several years ago  i thought what the hay its been awhile maybe things have changed  not so  i ordered blackened fish tacos my sister garlic parmesan wings  nthe first bite of my taco was so salty i could feel my blood pressure rising my sisters wings had the same problem  the server did offer us the option of getting something else of having the item removed from our bill  however the mood was ruinednni was very disappointed in this meal  i will definitely not be returning

during my time in the army i had a habit of visiting logans in tennessee where i would often indulge in drinking excessively caring little about the quality of the food but now that the chain has expanded to arizona and i have quit drinking the only things worth mentioning here are the tasty rolls and delightful sweet tea any higher expectations will likely lead to disappointment
i stayed here during a business tripolder crowd and a little quiet but it was nice that i could play any game i wanted without a wait i learned how to play three card poker and i made 35000

at this establishment the staff is known for their friendliness and offers customers a hand wash service at a reasonable price while they may not always have a lot of customers they have built a strong reputation over time sadly they do not prioritize making your car look pristine after inspecting the car more closely i found multiple watermarks and streaks on it once i returned home personally i believe that if the staff takes it up a notch they would find great success considering their strategic location along scottsdale road

i ordered a spinach goat cheese and sundried tomatoe omelet it was horrible the cheese was not inside but on top  cold and unmelted the omelet was actually more of a fritatta as it was brown all over from being overcooked i mentioned this to the employee who brought the dish to my table but my complaint went ignored even after eating only one bite of the omelet  it was cold on top of everything else  no one seemed to care after spending 13 for an omelet and glass of milk youd think theyd jump through hoops to make people happy given their prices never again this was my second visit and i was unhappy after my first hoping the first visit was a fluke i gave this restaurant a second chance big mistake on my partnnthe employees were very friendly when i ordered but this isnt enough to make up for the lack of concern  or care over my displeasure the food is not good and the prices are way too high for what you get

original phrase i am giving an extra star to hugos because of the excellent service provided by the wait staff especially victor and vincent they went above and beyond and exceeded our expectations however i was not overly impressed with the food although the fillet was large in size it lacked character and did not live up to being one of the best fillets i have ever had it was missing that wow factor on a positive note the mashed potatoes were outstanding even if they were potentially dangerous i would still eat them in large quantities my wife ordered the veal which was decent but nothing special the salads were good the service was great and the wine list was extensive if you are downtown it is worth a visit but i wouldnt go out of my way to come here from the strip

back when i served in the army logans in tennessee used to be my goto spot i would often drink so much that the flavor of the food became inconsequential however now that logans has been established in arizona for quite some time and ive adopted a sober lifestyle the only redeeming aspects of this place are its delectable rolls and refreshing sweet tea dont set your hopes too high if you decide to eat here

the wait staff at hugos particularly victor and vincent deserve an extra star for their outstanding service they blew us away with their attentive and efficient assistance on the other hand the food itself left me underwhelmed despite the fact that the fillet was quite sizable it did not live up to its reputation as one of the best fillets i have ever tasted it lacked a certain uniqueness and failed to provide any unexpected delights however the mashed potatoes were undeniably the highlight of the meal even if they were potentially hazardous i would still indulge in them wholeheartedly in contrast my wife tried the veal which was edible but not memorable enough to order again the salads were enjoyable the service was exceptional and the wine list impressed us with its variety i would recommend visiting this restaurant if you find yourself downtown although i question whether it is worth the 20dollar cab fare to and from the strip

despite enduring a grueling 12hour shift in the sun without breaks or lunch i couldnt contain my excitement about trying out this restaurant upon arrival we discovered that it was a wellmaintained and sanitary establishment unfortunately our patience was tested when our food didnt arrive for a whopping 4560 minutes despite being ordered for two people and a oneyearold child my baby became increasingly exhausted and bored interestingly even the manager made the assumption that we had finished our meal asking if there was anything else we required however i informed him that we were still awaiting our main course which hadnt even been served yet perhaps if the place offered some form of entertainment such as a movie or access to netflix on their tv we might consider returning nevertheless with countless thai food options available this particular eatery receives an unfavorable two thumbs down from us making the neighboring taco shop appear much more enticing

while exploring las vegas dont miss out on an essential activity – vegas balloon rides although alternative options exist in california nothing matches the spectacular panorama seen from this particular ride it offers a stunning display of the famous strip upfront picturesque red rock canyon behind and a picturesque backdrop of vegas city to one side with newer neighborhoods to the other the convenience factor was noteworthy as the crew either picked us up from our hotel or allowed us to rendezvous at a local starbucks providing an opportunity to grab coffee before dawn during this time they explained the entire procedure for the forthcoming adventure emphasizing that we as customers would actively participate in balloon setup and dismantling admittedly some complain about this aspect but lets cut them some slack – handling heavy balloons is no easy job especially given the crew members age when the balloon was almost ready the attentive crew ensured everyone had ample photo opportunities both inside and outside the balloon as we took off and ascended more than 1000ft into the sky vegas transformed into a surprisingly serene and peaceful setting despite its reputation as a vibrant party city when we faced red rock canyon i tapped into my talent for blocking out the world immersing myself solely in the aweinspiring masterpiece crafted by mother nature the pilot and crew contributed significantly to our overall enjoyment fostering a friendly and comfortable atmosphere through their humor and lighthearted banter to conclude the ride we were treated to champagne and cheese – not extravagant but undoubtedly a thoughtful touch with utmost confidence i wholeheartedly recommend vegas balloon rides

at this particular establishment the quality of the food is outstanding and they certainly dont compromise when it comes to the meat portions their pho dishes come with plenty of noodles served in generously sized bowls however one downside is the absence of ceiling fans despite the sweltering heat outside in las vegas we found ourselves sweating profusely reminiscent of an intense workout session regardless my friends and i thoroughly relished our dining experience as we had ordered a diverse selection of dishes from the menu all of which were absolutely delectable

my dog has been groomed here for the past year there is only one particular groomer we use since weve experienced our dog returned to us with her fur wet and smelling like we just dropped her off we would only take our dog in because of that groomer she takes her time and provides us with a pawgress report we made an appointment 2 weeks prior called to confirm the day of we get there early and 2 of there workers ask me if ive been helped and i still stood there then this other worker comes up and asks me for her rabies vaccination papers huh i understand we need to provide vaccination paper work but why wouldnt the workers mention that when i scheduled the appointment or when i called that morning to confirm then he asks me how far i live and if i can go get it so my scheduled appointment doesnt cause a delay for others in addition to that im given an attitude dont bother wasting your time or money here

i along with my friend chose to visit this place over memorial day weekend arriving during the shift from brunch to dinner hours despite our timing we were charged the higher dinner prices nonetheless we were pleased at being able to enjoy a variety of dishes initially we found the price for a vegas buffet to be reasonable however when it came to the quality of the food we werent as impressed i opted to gather a bit of every dish discovering that the only standout was the lobster mac and cheese shrimp cocktail and crab legs following some experimentation i ended up filling up on the more expensive offerings to make sure i felt like i got my moneys worth my attention was also drawn to the prime rib but upon hearing my friends complaint about her overcooked slice despite requesting a mediumrare cut i decided to pass on it after observing the appearance of the meats it was truly disappointing furthermore their selection of desserts left a lot to be desired i made an effort to collect visually pleasing treats such as macaroons eclairs tarts and even a chocolatecovered strawberry onto my plate but unfortunately they all proved to be mediocre in taste most items only received one bite from me the only exception being the flan which i tried twice but even then it failed to impress the only dessert that i managed to consume completely was a cappuccino shooter without whipped cream on top
i have been a customer here for years and the quality of service is unmatched i have never felt cheated or overcharged

i thoroughly enjoyed my time at this classic and traditional establishment it was a delightful experience especially with the added bonus of a complimentary room upgrade with a fantastic view i highly recommend trying it out as it is definitely worth it however i must mention that the room itself was not extraordinary nor subpar but rather average take note that the bathroom is quite small restricting your ability to freely open and close the door while seated on the toilet  consider yourself warned nonetheless the casino provided much entertainment and my gambling funds lasted impressively longer compared to when i had stayed on the strip personally i adore starting my trip downtown due to the convenience of everything being in close proximity plus the added advantage of low craps betting limits

tex az is a popular spot for meeting up with people in central phoenix especially those from out of town who expect arizona restaurants to have a local saloonlike atmosphere we often bring newcomers here because it feels more authentic than other places like rawhide personally i grew up on a cattle farm and know good steak so i can vouch that the aged steaks at tex az are flavorful and wellcut you wont be disappointed try their basic but satisfactory ny strip presentation the prices are not as steep as ruths chris

this place had been on my radar for quite some time so naturally i had high hopes unfortunately i was left disappointed the only positive aspect worth mentioning was the delectable sauce whereas all the meats were dry and devoid of flavor on the bright side the service was commendable especially considering it was a monday as for the prices they would have been justifiable if the overall quality and taste were better specifically i tried the brisket ribs and pulled pork with the latter being the savior that rescued my review from receiving a measly onestar rating
i had the pretzel dog the dog tasted really good and juicy  auntie aunts lemonade is better tho

i eagerly anticipated the dry aged ny strip at gallaghers in las vegas but unfortunately our friends decided to order the filet instead and couldnt stop raving about it my wife and i went with the ny strip and cowboy steak hoping for a similar level of satisfaction however while the cowboy steak scored a respectable 7 out of 10 the medium rare ny strip proved to be disappointingly tough chewy and difficult to swallow nonetheless the overall taste of the dish ranged from acceptable to good its worth noting that even the best restaurants occasionally serve a subpar cut of meat and regrettably this appears to have been one of those times

the sandwiches were satisfactory i tried the duke sandwich with cranberry mayo and horseradish but i found the horseradish to be too strong the quality of the meat was acceptable although if i hadnt been to places like jimmy johns or capriottis before i might have ranked them higher if i happen to be in the area again i would probably go back but im not sure if i would make a special trip for one of their sandwiches

i and the family love hotdogs especially chili dogs when we heard about this place and read some of the great reviews we were so eager to try it especially when the reviews for the onion rings were so good as well we currently live in maricopa az about 35 min drive from teds so we were really hoping it would be worth the drive we were disappointed we ordered 8 of the regular dogs i had chili mustard and onions on mine the wife and kids had just ketchup we also ordered onion rings and a strawberry shake the dogs themselves sure did look good when they were being cooked i love dogs cooked on a grill and these ones were nice and crispy on the outside but the four of us all gave them thumbs down for flavor very bland not even salt my chili sauce was the worst i have ever had it tasted more like tomato paste that i use as an ingredient in spaghetti sauce the onion rings were more like fragments with them looking like scraps that were swept up off the floor very overcooked with very little actual onion inside because they were burned up or something the milk shake was ok flavor but was in like a 6 oz cup or something seemed way overpriced as everything else i could not even finish my hotdogs which is probably a first in my lifetime and it is very rare that our whole family agrees that a place is no good the place did look kinda retro cool inside and was doing great business but we will not be back oh also the people working there looked like they were employees of a funeral home rather than fun themed hot dog joint total cost for 8 dogs a powerade strawberry shake and the order of onion fragments was almost 37 ridiculous
i tried the pretzel dog and found it to be incredibly delicious and succulent although my aunties homemade lemonade is still superior

giving an extra star to hugos is justified by the amazing service delivered by their wait staff specifically victor and vincent these two individuals truly went above and beyond exceeding our expectations unfortunately the food left much to be desired despite the fillets generous portion size it lacked the unique qualities that would earn it a spot among the best fillets i have ever had it failed to create that wow moment however the mashed potatoes were undeniably exceptional even if they happened to be hazardous i wouldnt hesitate to consume them in copious amounts conversely my wifes choice of veal was merely satisfactory and not something she would order again the salads were enjoyable the service was topnotch and the wine list showcased an impressive variety if you find yourself downtown its worth giving this place a shot although im unsure if its worth a 20 cab ride to and from the strip

a fantastic little bar in the neighborhood where its easy to become a regular customer any newly opened restaurant especially one with a building that has seen some wear and tear from previous owners will inevitably experience some struggles and problems as they get settled however even though this place has only been open for a week we were pleasantly surprised by the kindness of the staff and the variety of dishes on the menu the prices for the drinks are reasonable for a dive bar and the food menu is wonderfully unique and packed with tasty options there is an extensive selection of draft beers and several wines to choose from the management does an excellent job of handling difficult customers in a professional manner this establishment offers a pleasant change for residents in the area who are tired of opting for expensive chain restaurants or driving to other parts of town we cant wait to enjoy their many happy hour deals in the future and are excited about trying their brunch offerings it is my sincere wish that this thriving local business thrives and succeeds as our community truly needs more flourishing enterprises like this one

tex az has a unique atmosphere that captures the essence of a local saloon and steakhouse this ambiance adds character and charm to your dining experience the service is equally local and quirky contributing to the overall ambiance in all our visits we have never had to worry about beverages running dry parking can be a bit challenging on busy nights but it only enhances the charm of the place over the years we have been to tex az approximately 25 times and we were never disappointed however its crucial to note that this isnt gourmet dining instead they offer traditional hearty old west fare with simple yet great flavors

the sandwiches were decent i ordered the duke sandwich which came with cranberry mayo and horseradish unfortunately the horseradish flavor overpowered everything else the meat quality was okay but my opinion might have been better if i hadnt already tried jimmy johns or capriottis if i find myself in the neighborhood i might consider going back although im unsure if i would go out of my way just for their sandwiches

this was my first time here and i had high hopes because the reviews were really good the ladies were nice enough and the salon was clean i went in and asked for something pretty specific because my family are having pictures taken this week the tips the tech was putting tips on my nails where to small three of them cracked while the glue was dying she only removed one to affix a new nail tip the other two she tried to glue together unsuccessfully and continued to apply the acrylic on top when i said something about the cracked tips the tech told me that she would just paint something over them covering up the problem doesnt fix it the decoration i asked for was forgotten completely and instead i received the worst nail art ive ever had not at all what i wanted i now have to go to another salon to have these taken off and a new set put on im very disappointed

finally a dsw in tempe they have a wide selection of different brands and styles here as well as a good selection of purses to choose from the clearance section is always my first stop followed by a thorough browsing of each aisle  nnim always like a kid in a candy store at a dsw theres always something tempting to buynnservice was cheerful and friendly if youre part of their rewards program you can rack up points towards a coupon i redeemed a 10 coupon this visit and theyll also give you discounts for your birthday

when searching for pizza in the east valley nothing compares to the superb quality found at this eatery the secret lies in their meticulous ingredient selection which elevates their pizza from good to outstanding dont be fooled by the simple decor what awaits you is a harmonious blend of excellent ingredients delectable tomato sauce and an experience worth returning for
